cards.flavor:
"The emergence of the Eldrazi isn't necessarily a bad thing, as long as you've already lived a fulfilling and complete life without regrets."
—Javad Nasrin, Ondu relic hunter
cards.name: All Is Dust
cards.text: Each player sacrifices all colored permanents he or she controls.

cards.name: Artisan of Kozilek
cards.text:
When you cast Artisan of Kozilek, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
Annihilator 2 (Whenever this creature attacks, defending player sacrifices two permanents.)

cards.name: Emrakul, the Aeons Torn
cards.text:
Emrakul, the Aeons Torn can't be countered.
When you cast Emrakul, take an extra turn after this one.
Flying, protection from colored spells, annihilator 6
When Emrakul is put into a graveyard from anywhere, its owner shuffles his or her graveyard into his or her library.

cards.name: Karn Liberated
cards.text:
+4: Target player exiles a card from his or her hand.
−3: Exile target permanent.
−14: Restart the game, leaving in exile all non-Aura permanent cards exiled with Karn Liberated. Then put those cards onto the battlefield under your control.

cards.name: Kozilek, Butcher of Truth
cards.text:
When you cast Kozilek, Butcher of Truth, draw four cards.
Annihilator 4 (Whenever this creature attacks, defending player sacrifices four permanents.)
When Kozilek is put into a graveyard from anywhere, its owner shuffles his or her graveyard into his or her library.

cards.name: Ulamog, the Infinite Gyre
cards.text:
When you cast Ulamog, the Infinite Gyre, destroy target permanent.
Indestructible
Annihilator 4 (Whenever this creature attacks, defending player sacrifices four permanents.)
When Ulamog is put into a graveyard from anywhere, its owner shuffles his or her graveyard into his or her library.

cards.flavor:
"Whatever the Eldrazi's purpose is, it has nothing to do with something so insignificant as us."
—Nirthu, lone missionary
cards.name: Ulamog's Crusher
cards.text:
Annihilator 2 (Whenever this creature attacks, defending player sacrifices two permanents.)
Ulamog's Crusher attacks each turn if able.

cards.name: Apostle's Blessing
cards.text:
({W/P} can be paid with either {W} or 2 life.)
Target artifact or creature you control gains protection from artifacts or from the color of your choice until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Bladehold houses a rogues' gallery filled with the living "statues" of the worst enemies of the Auriok.
cards.name: Arrest
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block, and its activated abilities can't be activated.

cards.name: Battlegrace Angel
cards.text:
Flying
Exalted (Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, that creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, it gains lifelink until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
"They say only the good die young. Obviously, you are one of the exceptions."
—Delrobah, cleric of Ivora Gate
cards.name: Celestial Purge
cards.text: Exile target black or red permanent.

cards.name: Conclave Phalanx
cards.text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
When Conclave Phalanx enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life for each creature you control.

cards.flavor: Mages of Esper measure their wealth and status by the number of servants in their retinues.
cards.name: Court Homunculus
cards.text: Court Homunculus gets +1/+1 as long as you control another artifact.

cards.flavor:
"Let the deception of the gods yield to the pure light of day."
—Brimaz, king of Oreskos
cards.name: Daybreak Coronet
cards.text:
Enchant creature with another Aura attached to it
Enchanted creature gets +3/+3 and has first strike, vigilance, and lifelink. (Damage dealt by the creature also causes its controller to gain that much life.)

cards.flavor: Venser wondered if it could still be called a teleportation spell if the destination is oblivion.
cards.name: Dispatch
cards.text:
Tap target creature.
Metalcraft — If you control three or more artifacts, exile that creature.

cards.flavor: "The Gitaxians whisper among themselves of other worlds. If they exist, we must bring Phyrexia's magnificence to them."
cards.name: Elesh Norn, Grand Cenobite
cards.text:
Vigilance
Other creatures you control get +2/+2.
Creatures your opponents control get -2/-2.

cards.flavor:
"Where metal is tainted and wood is scarce, we are best armed by faith."
—Tavalus, acolyte of Korlis
cards.name: Fortify
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Creatures you control get +2/+0 until end of turn.
• Creatures you control get +0/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Hikari, Twilight Guardian
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, you may exile Hikari, Twilight Guardian. If you do, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control at the beginning of the next end step.

cards.flavor:
"Every sword drawn to defend is an angelic blade, guided to justice by an angelic hand."
—Auriok proverb
cards.name: Indomitable Archangel
cards.text:
Flying
Metalcraft — Artifacts you control have shroud as long as you control three or more artifacts. (An artifact with shroud can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

cards.flavor: No more shall the righteous cower before evil.
cards.name: Iona, Shield of Emeria
cards.text:
Flying
As Iona, Shield of Emeria enters the battlefield, choose a color.
Your opponents can't cast spells of the chosen color.

cards.flavor:
"Duty and law are the foundation on which civilization stands. They must not fall, for when they do, they take everything with them."
—Lord Konda
cards.name: Kami of Ancient Law
cards.text: Sacrifice Kami of Ancient Law: Destroy target enchantment.

cards.flavor: "Swords cannot reach far enough. Chains cannot strike hard enough. An eternal dilemma, but a simple one."
cards.name: Kor Duelist
cards.text: As long as Kor Duelist is equipped, it has double strike. (It deals both first-strike and regular combat damage.)

cards.name: Leyline of Sanctity
cards.text:
If Leyline of Sanctity is in your opening hand, you may begin the game with it on the battlefield.
You have hexproof. (You can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)

cards.flavor:
"The southern fortress taken by invaders? Heh, sure . . . when elephants fly."
—Brezard Skeinbow, captain of the guard
cards.name: Mighty Leap
cards.text: Target creature gets +2/+2 and gains flying until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)

cards.flavor: A symbol of what Mirrodin once was and hope for what it will be again.
cards.name: Mirran Crusader
cards.text: Double strike, protection from black and from green

cards.flavor: Unaware of Lorwyn's diversity, it sees only itself, reflected a thousand times over.
cards.name: Mirror Entity
cards.text:
Changeling (This card is every creature type.)
{X}: Until end of turn, creatures you control have base power and toughness X/X and gain all creature types.

cards.name: Moonlit Strider
cards.text:
Sacrifice Moonlit Strider: Target creature you control gains protection from the color of your choice until end of turn.
Soulshift 3 (When this creature dies, you may return target Spirit card with converted mana cost 3 or less from your graveyard to your hand.)

cards.flavor: The Auriok see the artificer as a conduit, beckoning new creations into the world.
cards.name: Myrsmith
cards.text: Whenever you cast an artifact spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, put a 1/1 colorless Myr artifact creature token onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Oblivion Ring
cards.text:
When Oblivion Ring enters the battlefield, exile another target nonland permanent.
When Oblivion Ring leaves the battlefield, return the exiled card to the battlefield under its owner's control.

cards.flavor:
"The landscape shimmered and I felt a chill breeze. When my vision cleared, I found myself alone among the corpses of my fallen friends."
—Journal found in Numai
cards.name: Otherworldly Journey
cards.text: Exile target creature. At the beginning of the next end step, return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.

cards.flavor: Like blinking or breathing, responding to an alarm is an involuntary reflex.
cards.name: Raise the Alarm
cards.text: Put two 1/1 white Soldier creature tokens onto the battlefield.

cards.flavor:
"Like dawn's first light, blind the unprepared and banish the shadows."
—Skyhunter creed
cards.name: Skyhunter Skirmisher
cards.text: Flying, double strike

cards.flavor:
"I need never remember my past associates, my victims, my mistakes. Innistrad preserves them all for me."
—Sorin Markov
cards.name: Spectral Procession
cards.text: Put three 1/1 white Spirit creature tokens with flying onto the battlefield.

cards.flavor:
"It's easy for the innocent to speak of justice. They seldom feel its terrible power."
—Orim, Samite inquisitor
cards.name: Sunlance
cards.text: Sunlance deals 3 damage to target nonwhite creature.

cards.flavor: Left without their leader Raksha, the leonin split into two prides: one side supported the regent kha, while the other rebelled in fury.
cards.name: Sunspear Shikari
cards.text: As long as Sunspear Shikari is equipped, it has first strike and lifelink.

cards.name: Taj-Nar Swordsmith
cards.text: When Taj-Nar Swordsmith enters the battlefield, you may pay {X}. If you do, search your library for an Equipment card with converted mana cost X or less and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

cards.flavor:
"The jeweler, the potter, the smith . . . They all imbue a bit of their souls into their creations. The kami destroy that crafted mortal shell and absorb the soul within."
—Noboru, master kitemaker
cards.name: Terashi's Grasp
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment. You gain life equal to its converted mana cost.

cards.name: Waxmane Baku
cards.text:
Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, you may put a ki counter on Waxmane Baku.
{1}, Remove X ki counters from Waxmane Baku: Tap X target creatures.

cards.name: Æthersnipe
cards.text:
When Æthersnipe enters the battlefield, return target nonland permanent to its owner's hand.
Evoke {1}{U}{U} (You may cast this spell for its evoke cost. If you do, it's sacrificed when it enters the battlefield.)

cards.flavor:
"Wind is forceful, yet ephemeral. It can knock a dragon out of the sky, yet pass through the smallest crack unhindered."
—Jestus Dreya, Of Elements and Eternity
cards.name: Air Servant
cards.text:
Flying
{2}{U}: Tap target creature with flying.

cards.flavor: A great mirage, a dream of wings and silver.
cards.name: Argent Sphinx
cards.text:
Flying
Metalcraft — {U}: Exile Argent Sphinx. Return it to the battlefield under your control at the beginning of the next end step. Activate this ability only if you control three or more artifacts.

cards.flavor:
"The sky teems with just as much life as the forest or the deep seas."
—Hadi Kasten, Calla Dale naturalist
cards.name: Cloud Elemental
cards.text:
Flying
Cloud Elemental can block only creatures with flying.

cards.name: Cryptic Command
cards.text:
Choose two —
• Counter target spell.
• Return target permanent to its owner's hand.
• Tap all creatures your opponents control.
• Draw a card.

cards.name: Faerie Mechanist
cards.text:
Flying
When Faerie Mechanist enters the battlefield, look at the top three cards of your library. You may reveal an artifact card from among them and put it into your hand. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

cards.flavor:
"Your downfall was not your ignorance, your weakness, or your hubris, but your warm blood."
—Heidar, Rimewind master
cards.name: Flashfreeze
cards.text: Counter target red or green spell.

cards.name: Guile
cards.text:
Guile can't be blocked except by three or more creatures.
If a spell or ability you control would counter a spell, instead exile that spell and you may play that card without paying its mana cost.
When Guile is put into a graveyard from anywhere, shuffle it into its owner's library.

cards.name: Helium Squirter
cards.text:
Graft 3 (This creature enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it. Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, you may move a +1/+1 counter from this creature onto it.)
{1}: Target creature with a +1/+1 counter on it gains flying until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Hurkyl's research at the College of Lat-Nam wasn't enough to stop the two brothers, but for centuries thereafter her spellcraft taught artificers restraint.
cards.name: Hurkyl's Recall
cards.text: Return all artifacts target player owns to his or her hand.

cards.flavor:
"See how gratefully this world accepts our blessings."
—Jin-Gitaxias, Core Augur
cards.name: Inexorable Tide
cards.text: Whenever you cast a spell, proliferate. (You choose any number of permanents and/or players with counters on them, then give each another counter of a kind already there.)

cards.flavor: The fatal flaw in every plan is the assumption that you know more than your enemy.
cards.name: Mana Leak
cards.text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {3}.

cards.name: Mulldrifter
cards.text:
Flying
When Mulldrifter enters the battlefield, draw two cards.
Evoke {2}{U} (You may cast this spell for its evoke cost. If you do, it's sacrificed when it enters the battlefield.)

cards.flavor:
"It's so cute when it's sleeping, isn't it? Actually, it's still as abhorrent as ever, but at least it's not trying to kill us."
—Noyan Dar, Tazeem lullmage
cards.name: Narcolepsy
cards.text:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of each upkeep, if enchanted creature is untapped, tap it.

cards.name: Novijen Sages
cards.text:
Graft 4 (This creature enters the battlefield with four +1/+1 counters on it. Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, you may move a +1/+1 counter from this creature onto it.)
{1}, Remove two +1/+1 counters from among creatures you control: Draw a card.

cards.flavor: Even the clouds bend themselves to Memnarch's will, eager to swallow those who oppose him.
cards.name: Qumulox
cards.text:
Affinity for artifacts (This spell costs {1} less to cast for each artifact you control.)
Flying

cards.flavor: For the Azorius, the law can be a physical shield against chaos and anarchy.
cards.name: Remand
cards.text:
Counter target spell. If that spell is countered this way, put it into its owner's hand instead of into that player's graveyard.
Draw a card.

cards.flavor:
"Your deed cannot be undone. You, however, can be."
—Agosto, Azorius imperator
cards.name: Repeal
cards.text:
Return target nonland permanent with converted mana cost X to its owner's hand.
Draw a card.

cards.flavor: The vedalken interrogate all intruders—once the hoverguards are done with them.
cards.name: Somber Hoverguard
cards.text:
Affinity for artifacts (This spell costs {1} less to cast for each artifact you control.)
Flying

cards.flavor: "More of that strange oil . . . It's probably nothing."
cards.name: Steady Progress
cards.text:
Proliferate. (You choose any number of permanents and/or players with counters on them, then give each another counter of a kind already there.)
Draw a card.

cards.flavor: Obsessed with the pursuit of knowledge above all else, vedalken can appear to be cold and emotionless.
cards.name: Stoic Rebuttal
cards.text:
Metalcraft — Stoic Rebuttal costs {1} less to cast if you control three or more artifacts.
Counter target spell.

cards.name: Surrakar Spellblade
cards.text:
Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, you may put a charge counter on Surrakar Spellblade.
Whenever Surrakar Spellblade deals combat damage to a player, you may draw X cards, where X is the number of charge counters on it.

cards.flavor: Mastery is achieved when "telling time" becomes "telling time what to do."
cards.name: Telling Time
cards.text: Look at the top three cards of your library. Put one of those cards into your hand, one on top of your library, and one on the bottom of your library.

cards.name: Tezzeret the Seeker
cards.text:
+1: Untap up to two target artifacts.
−X: Search your library for an artifact card with converted mana cost X or less and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
−5: Artifacts you control become artifact creatures with base power and toughness 5/5 until end of turn.

cards.name: Tezzeret's Gambit
cards.text:
({U/P} can be paid with either {U} or 2 life.)
Draw two cards, then proliferate. (You choose any number of permanents and/or players with counters on them, then give each another counter of a kind already there.)

cards.flavor: Vedalken eyes don't see the beauty in things. They see only what those things can teach.
cards.name: Thoughtcast
cards.text:
Affinity for artifacts (This spell costs {1} less to cast for each artifact you control.)
Draw two cards.

cards.name: Thrummingbird
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Thrummingbird deals combat damage to a player, proliferate. (You choose any number of permanents and/or players with counters on them, then give each another counter of a kind already there.)

cards.flavor:
"This creature is inadequate. Send it to the splicers for innovation."
—Malcator, Executor of Synthesis
cards.name: Vapor Snag
cards.text: Return target creature to its owner's hand. Its controller loses 1 life.

cards.name: Vendilion Clique
cards.text:
Flash
Flying
When Vendilion Clique enters the battlefield, look at target player's hand. You may choose a nonland card from it. If you do, that player reveals the chosen card, puts it on the bottom of his or her library, then draws a card.

cards.name: Vigean Graftmage
cards.text:
Graft 2 (This creature enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it. Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, you may move a +1/+1 counter from this creature onto it.)
{1}{U}: Untap target creature with a +1/+1 counter on it.

cards.flavor:
"This creature has innate perceptiveness. It knows when to rise and when to vanish into the tides."
—Jestus Dreya, Of Elements and Eternity
cards.name: Water Servant
cards.text:
{U}: Water Servant gets +1/-1 until end of turn.
{U}: Water Servant gets -1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Changeling magic grants unusual wishes.
cards.name: Wings of Velis Vel
cards.text:
Changeling (This card is every creature type.)
Until end of turn, target creature has base power and toughness 4/4, gains all creature types, and gains flying.

cards.flavor: In Lorwyn's brief evenings, the sun pauses at the horizon long enough for a certain species of violet to bloom with the fragrance of mischief.
cards.name: Bitterblossom
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you lose 1 life and put a 1/1 black Faerie Rogue creature token with flying onto the battlefield.

cards.flavor: Some humans willingly offered up their blood, hoping it would grant the vampire families the strength to stave off the Eldrazi.
cards.name: Bloodthrone Vampire
cards.text: Sacrifice a creature: Bloodthrone Vampire gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Witches of the Split-Eye Coven speak of a future when Grixis will overflow with life energy. For now, they must harvest vis from the living to fuel their dark magics.
cards.name: Bone Splinters
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast Bone Splinters, sacrifice a creature.
Destroy target creature.

cards.flavor: The Simic use the claws as scalpels, while the Rakdos use them for tattooing and torture. The Gruul use them to pick their teeth after lunching on the rest of the carcass.
cards.name: Daggerclaw Imp
cards.text:
Flying
Daggerclaw Imp can't block.

cards.flavor: Greatness, at any cost.
cards.name: Dark Confidant
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, reveal the top card of your library and put that card into your hand. You lose life equal to its converted mana cost.

cards.flavor: Takenuma was filled with a chorus of moans, shrieks, and wails. Some came from the living, some from the dying, and some, most horribly, from the dead.
cards.name: Death Denied
cards.text: Return X target creature cards from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.flavor: There are few ways to escape the deathmark: bargaining with a demon, washing in the fabled waters of youth, and of course, death.
cards.name: Deathmark
cards.text: Destroy target green or white creature.

cards.name: Devouring Greed
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast Devouring Greed, you may sacrifice any number of Spirits.
Target player loses 2 life plus 2 life for each Spirit sacrificed this way. You gain that much life.

cards.flavor:
"You serve Phyrexia. Your pieces would better serve Phyrexia elsewhere."
—Azax-Azog, the Demon Thane
cards.name: Dismember
cards.text:
({B/P} can be paid with either {B} or 2 life.)
Target creature gets -5/-5 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Each Eldrazi ancient spawned a lineage of horrors in unfathomable shapes.
cards.name: Dread Drone
cards.text: When Dread Drone enters the battlefield, put two 0/1 colorless Eldrazi Spawn creature tokens onto the battlefield. They have "Sacrifice this creature: Add {1} to your mana pool."

cards.flavor: The swamps go silent at its approach, but it still hears the heartbeat of the prey within.
cards.name: Duskhunter Bat
cards.text:
Bloodthirst 1 (If an opponent was dealt damage this turn, this creature enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it.)
Flying

cards.name: Endrek Sahr, Master Breeder
cards.text:
Whenever you cast a creature spell, put X 1/1 black Thrull creature tokens onto the battlefield, where X is that spell's converted mana cost.
When you control seven or more Thrulls, sacrifice Endrek Sahr, Master Breeder.

cards.flavor: In desolate places, changelings may take the shape of fancies, or memories, or fears.
cards.name: Ghostly Changeling
cards.text:
Changeling (This card is every creature type.)
{1}{B}: Ghostly Changeling gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Even the small wounds let hope bleed out.
cards.name: Grim Affliction
cards.text: Put a -1/-1 counter on target creature, then proliferate. (You choose any number of permanents and/or players with counters on them, then give each another counter of a kind already there.)

cards.flavor:
"The results of our ninth inoculation were the same. The specimen was, of course, euthanized before the contagion could spread."
—Vedalken research notes
cards.name: Instill Infection
cards.text:
Put a -1/-1 counter on target creature.
Draw a card.

cards.flavor: Many have heard the beginning of its low, sustained shriek but few the end.
cards.name: Midnight Banshee
cards.text:
Wither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a -1/-1 counter on each nonblack creature.

cards.flavor: Just as a changeling's influence can have dramatic effects, so too can its sudden withdrawal.
cards.name: Nameless Inversion
cards.text:
Changeling (This card is every creature type.)
Target creature gets +3/-3 and loses all creature types until end of turn.

cards.name: Necroskitter
cards.text:
Wither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)
Whenever a creature an opponent controls with a -1/-1 counter on it dies, you may return that card to the battlefield under your control.

cards.flavor:
"Look at her, once filled with innocence. Death has a way of wringing away such . . . deficiencies."
—Savra
cards.name: Plagued Rusalka
cards.text: {B}, Sacrifice a creature: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Profane Command
cards.text:
Choose two —
• Target player loses X life. 
• Return target creature card with converted mana cost X or less from your graveyard to the battlefield.
• Target creature gets -X/-X until end of turn.
• Up to X target creatures gain fear until end of turn. (They can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)

cards.name: Puppeteer Clique
cards.text:
Flying
When Puppeteer Clique enters the battlefield, put target creature card from an opponent's graveyard onto the battlefield under your control. It gains haste. At the beginning of your next end step, exile it.
Persist (When this creature dies, if it had no -1/-1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a -1/-1 counter on it.)

cards.flavor: Though you may see the same bones, you'll never see the same skeleton twice.
cards.name: Reassembling Skeleton
cards.text: {1}{B}: Return Reassembling Skeleton from your graveyard to the battlefield tapped.

cards.flavor: Dragons consider drakes to be mockeries of their perfection, destroying them on sight.
cards.name: Scavenger Drake
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever another creature dies, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Scavenger Drake.

cards.name: Scuttling Death
cards.text:
Sacrifice Scuttling Death: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
Soulshift 4 (When this creature dies, you may return target Spirit card with converted mana cost 4 or less from your graveyard to your hand.)

cards.flavor:
"Have you ever killed insects nibbling at your crops? I think that's what the Eldrazi believe they're doing to us."
—Sheyda, Ondu gamekeeper
cards.name: Shrivel
cards.text: All creatures get -1/-1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: His sickle was forged in the heat of another cinder's funeral pyre.
cards.name: Sickle Ripper
cards.text: Wither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)

cards.flavor: Little agonies pave the way to greater power.
cards.name: Sign in Blood
cards.text: Target player draws two cards and loses 2 life.

cards.flavor: Life is ephemeral. Phyrexia is eternal.
cards.name: Spread the Sickness
cards.text: Destroy target creature, then proliferate. (You choose any number of permanents and/or players with counters on them, then give each another counter of a kind already there.)

cards.name: Surgical Extraction
cards.text:
({B/P} can be paid with either {B} or 2 life.)
Choose target card in a graveyard other than a basic land card. Search its owner's graveyard, hand, and library for any number of cards with the same name as that card and exile them. Then that player shuffles his or her library.

cards.name: Thief of Hope
cards.text:
Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, target opponent loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.
Soulshift 2 (When this creature dies, you may return target Spirit card with converted mana cost 2 or less from your graveyard to your hand.)

cards.flavor: The lacerators cut themselves before each hunt. They must feed before the sun rises or bleed to death.
cards.name: Vampire Lacerator
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you lose 1 life unless an opponent has 10 or less life.

cards.flavor: Some vampires reject the decadent trappings of their kind. Once they turn feral, no amount of blood will satisfy their hunger.
cards.name: Vampire Outcasts
cards.text:
Bloodthirst 2 (If an opponent was dealt damage this turn, this creature enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it.)
Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)

cards.flavor:
"Once each year, the oni and other evil spirits paraded through villages to disturb mortals' sleep. During the war, this parade became a nightly event."
—Observations of the Kami War
cards.name: Waking Nightmare
cards.text: Target player discards two cards.

cards.flavor: For Sarkhan Vol, the dragon is the purest expression of life's savage splendor.
cards.name: Banefire
cards.text:
Banefire deals X damage to target creature or player.
If X is 5 or more, Banefire can't be countered by spells or abilities and the damage can't be prevented.

cards.flavor: "The changing kind suffers as we do. We must join as one to quench our tyrants!"
cards.name: Blades of Velis Vel
cards.text:
Changeling (This card is every creature type.)
Up to two target creatures each get +2/+0 and gain all creature types until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
"Ogres taunt the dragons by moving into their territory, but even the hellkites find them too much trouble to hunt."
—Marza, mountain scout
cards.name: Blood Ogre
cards.text:
Bloodthirst 1 (If an opponent was dealt damage this turn, this creature enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it.)
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)

cards.flavor: "Just think how strong I'll be if my arms don't tear off!"
cards.name: Bloodshot Trainee
cards.text: {T}: Bloodshot Trainee deals 4 damage to target creature. Activate this ability only if Bloodshot Trainee's power is 4 or greater.

cards.flavor: Blood, bone, and sinew are magnified, as is the rage that drives them. The brain, however, remains unchanged—a little bean, swinging by a strand in a cavernous, raving head.
cards.name: Brute Force
cards.text: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

cards.name: Burst Lightning
cards.text:
Kicker {4} (You may pay an additional {4} as you cast this spell.)
Burst Lightning deals 2 damage to target creature or player. If Burst Lightning was kicked, it deals 4 damage to that creature or player instead.

cards.name: Combust
cards.text:
Combust can't be countered by spells or abilities.
Combust deals 5 damage to target white or blue creature. The damage can't be prevented.

cards.name: Comet Storm
cards.text:
Multikicker {1} (You may pay an additional {1} any number of times as you cast this spell.)
Choose target creature or player, then choose another target creature or player for each time Comet Storm was kicked. Comet Storm deals X damage to each of them.

cards.flavor: The farther he roamed from Jund and its dragons, the more he felt their essence in himself.
cards.name: Dragonsoul Knight
cards.text:
First strike
{W}{U}{B}{R}{G}: Until end of turn, Dragonsoul Knight becomes a Dragon, gets +5/+3, and gains flying and trample.

cards.flavor: Jund feasts on the unprepared.
cards.name: Fiery Fall
cards.text:
Fiery Fall deals 5 damage to target creature.
Basic landcycling {1}{R} ({1}{R}, Discard this card: Search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.)

cards.flavor: A rock between your eyes hurts. A burning rock between your eyes ruins your whole day.
cards.name: Goblin Fireslinger
cards.text: {T}: Goblin Fireslinger deals 1 damage to target player.

cards.flavor: War paint made from kolya fruit heightens senses and lessens fear. Unfortunately, fear is usually what keeps you alive.
cards.name: Goblin War Paint
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has haste.

cards.flavor: Some of the eleven minotaur clans of Mirtiin are expert crafters and learned philosophers. Others just like to hit stuff.
cards.name: Gorehorn Minotaurs
cards.text: Bloodthirst 2 (If an opponent was dealt damage this turn, this creature enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it.)

cards.flavor:
"Down here, we have a more pointed version of the scriptures."
—Urabrask's enforcer
cards.name: Gut Shot
cards.text:
({R/P} can be paid with either {R} or 2 life.)
Gut Shot deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Hellkite Charger
cards.text:
Flying, haste
Whenever Hellkite Charger attacks, you may pay {5}{R}{R}. If you do, untap all attacking creatures and after this phase, there is an additional combat phase.

cards.name: Incandescent Soulstoke
cards.text:
Other Elemental creatures you control get +1/+1.
{1}{R}, {T}: You may put an Elemental creature card from your hand onto the battlefield. That creature gains haste until end of turn. Sacrifice it at the beginning of the next end step.

cards.flavor: A light an army can follow.
cards.name: Inner-Flame Igniter
cards.text: {2}{R}: Creatures you control get +1/+0 until end of turn. If this is the third time this ability has resolved this turn, creatures you control gain first strike until end of turn.

cards.name: Kiki-Jiki, Mirror Breaker
cards.text:
Haste
{T}: Put a token that's a copy of target nonlegendary creature you control onto the battlefield. That token has haste. Sacrifice it at the beginning of the next end step.

cards.flavor: The sparkmage shrieked, calling on the rage of the storms of his youth. To his surprise, the sky responded with a fierce energy he'd never thought to see again.
cards.name: Lightning Bolt
cards.text: Lightning Bolt deals 3 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Skarrgan Firebird
cards.text:
Bloodthirst 3 (If an opponent was dealt damage this turn, this creature enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it.)
Flying
{R}{R}{R}: Return Skarrgan Firebird from your graveyard to your hand. Activate this ability only if an opponent was dealt damage this turn.

cards.flavor: The giant Tarvik dreamed that trinkets and machines caused all the world's woe. When he awoke from his troubled sleep, he took the name Tarvik Relicsmasher.
cards.name: Smash to Smithereens
cards.text: Destroy target artifact. Smash to Smithereens deals 3 damage to that artifact's controller.

cards.flavor: "Be silent and listen to your inner fire. Only then can you walk the Path of Flame."
cards.name: Smokebraider
cards.text: {T}: Add two mana in any combination of colors to your mana pool. Spend this mana only to cast Elemental spells or activate abilities of Elementals.

cards.flavor: When provoked, a flamekin's inner fire burns far hotter than any giant's forge.
cards.name: Soulbright Flamekin
cards.text: {2}: Target creature gains trample until end of turn. If this is the third time this ability has resolved this turn, you may add {R}{R}{R}{R}{R}{R}{R}{R} to your mana pool.

cards.flavor: Now that he knows a thousand ways of hurting people, his next shamanic quest is to discover a thousand more.
cards.name: Spikeshot Elder
cards.text: {1}{R}{R}: Spikeshot Elder deals damage equal to its power to target creature or player.

cards.flavor: Disaster stalks with gaping jaws across unready lands.
cards.name: Spitebellows
cards.text:
When Spitebellows leaves the battlefield, it deals 6 damage to target creature.
Evoke {1}{R}{R} (You may cast this spell for its evoke cost. If you do, it's sacrificed when it enters the battlefield.)

cards.flavor: "I know just the person for that job."
cards.name: Splinter Twin
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has "{T}: Put a token that's a copy of this creature onto the battlefield. That token has haste. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step."

cards.flavor: Blood is holy to those whose god is War.
cards.name: Stormblood Berserker
cards.text:
Bloodthirst 2 (If an opponent was dealt damage this turn, this creature enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it.)
Menace (This creature can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)

cards.name: Thunderblust
cards.text:
Haste
Thunderblust has trample as long as it has a -1/-1 counter on it.
Persist (When this creature dies, if it had no -1/-1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a -1/-1 counter on it.)

cards.flavor:
"Fire is the universal language."
—Jhoira, master artificer
cards.name: Tribal Flames
cards.text: Domain — Tribal Flames deals X damage to target creature or player, where X is the number of basic land types among lands you control.

cards.flavor: "I'll fight two at once, and then lick their guts from my blades."
cards.name: Viashino Slaughtermaster
cards.text:
Double strike
{B}{G}: Viashino Slaughtermaster gets +1/+1 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.

cards.flavor: Fire is always at the top of the food chain, and it has a big appetite.
cards.name: Wildfire
cards.text: Each player sacrifices four lands. Wildfire deals 4 damage to each creature.

cards.name: Worldheart Phoenix
cards.text:
Flying
You may cast Worldheart Phoenix from your graveyard by paying {W}{U}{B}{R}{G} rather than paying its mana cost. If you do, it enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it.

cards.flavor:
"Our pyromancer's flames may not have killed them, but they bought us the time we needed."
—The War Diaries
cards.name: Wrap in Flames
cards.text: Wrap in Flames deals 1 damage to each of up to three target creatures. Those creatures can't block this turn.

cards.flavor: It lurks just under the surface, using the algae-choked tar pits of Jund as both home and hunting blind.
cards.name: Algae Gharial
cards.text:
Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
Whenever another creature dies, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Algae Gharial.

cards.flavor:
"When the fifth sun rose, Mirrodin saw its first true dawn."
—Inscribed on the skin of Thrun, the last troll
cards.name: All Suns' Dawn
cards.text: For each color, return up to one target card of that color from your graveyard to your hand. Exile All Suns' Dawn.

cards.flavor:
"Kill the queen first, or we'll be fighting her drones forever. It is not in a queen's nature to have enough servants."
—Borzard, exterminator captain
cards.name: Ant Queen
cards.text: {1}{G}: Put a 1/1 green Insect creature token onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Aquastrand Spider
cards.text:
Graft 2 (This creature enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it. Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, you may move a +1/+1 counter from this creature onto it.)
{G}: Target creature with a +1/+1 counter on it gains reach until end of turn. (It can block creatures with flying.)

cards.flavor:
"My battle cry reaches ears far keener than yours."
—Saidah, Joraga hunter
cards.name: Bestial Menace
cards.text: Put a 1/1 green Snake creature token, a 2/2 green Wolf creature token, and a 3/3 green Elephant creature token onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Commune with Nature
cards.text: Look at the top five cards of your library. You may reveal a creature card from among them and put it into your hand. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

cards.name: Cytoplast Root-Kin
cards.text:
Graft 4 (This creature enters the battlefield with four +1/+1 counters on it. Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, you may move a +1/+1 counter from this creature onto it.)
When Cytoplast Root-Kin enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on each other creature you control with a +1/+1 counter on it.
{2}: Move a +1/+1 counter from target creature you control onto Cytoplast Root-Kin.

cards.name: Gnarlid Pack
cards.text:
Multikicker {1}{G} (You may pay an additional {1}{G} any number of times as you cast this spell.)
Gnarlid Pack enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it for each time it was kicked.

cards.flavor: The strider's long, loping gait is an adaptation that allows it to move quickly in deep snow.
cards.name: Karplusan Strider
cards.text: Karplusan Strider can't be the target of blue or black spells.

cards.name: Kavu Primarch
cards.text:
Kicker {4} (You may pay an additional {4} as you cast this spell.)
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
If Kavu Primarch was kicked, it enters the battlefield with four +1/+1 counters on it.

cards.flavor: It's difficult to outwit something that doesn't speak, strategize, or even think.
cards.name: Kozilek's Predator
cards.text: When Kozilek's Predator enters the battlefield, put two 0/1 colorless Eldrazi Spawn creature tokens onto the battlefield. They have "Sacrifice this creature: Add {1} to your mana pool."

cards.flavor: When outsiders interrupted the matca championship, things got ugly.
cards.name: Matca Rioters
cards.text: Domain — Matca Rioters's power and toughness are each equal to the number of basic land types among lands you control.

cards.flavor:
"Sympathy is for weaklings. Whoever survives, wins."
—Benzir, archdruid of Temple Might
cards.name: Mutagenic Growth
cards.text:
({G/P} can be paid with either {G} or 2 life.)
Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: It nurtures its masters' glorious future.
cards.name: Nest Invader
cards.text: When Nest Invader enters the battlefield, put a 0/1 colorless Eldrazi Spawn creature token onto the battlefield. It has "Sacrifice this creature: Add {1} to your mana pool."

cards.flavor: She protects the sacred groves from blight, drought, and the Unbeholden.
cards.name: Noble Hierarch
cards.text:
Exalted (Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, that creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
{T}: Add {G}, {W}, or {U} to your mana pool.

cards.flavor: "Let the song of Selesnya be heard above the rhythm of our thundering hordes!"
cards.name: Overwhelm
cards.text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
Creatures you control get +3/+3 until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
"I trust the instincts of any beast over the advice of any human who presumes to be an expert in the art of war."
—Rinshel, elf insurgent
cards.name: Overwhelming Stampede
cards.text: Until end of turn, creatures you control gain trample and get +X/+X, where X is the greatest power among creatures you control.

cards.flavor: It eats what it wants to eat—which is anything that moves.
cards.name: Pelakka Wurm
cards.text:
Trample
When Pelakka Wurm enters the battlefield, you gain 7 life.
When Pelakka Wurm dies, draw a card.

cards.flavor:
"Let nothing own the skies but the wind."
—Dejara, Giltwood druid
cards.name: Plummet
cards.text: Destroy target creature with flying.

cards.flavor: When nature calls, run.
cards.name: Primeval Titan
cards.text:
Trample
Whenever Primeval Titan enters the battlefield or attacks, you may search your library for up to two land cards, put them onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle your library.

cards.flavor: Nature grows solutions to her problems.
cards.name: Rampant Growth
cards.text: Search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Root-Kin Ally
cards.text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
Tap two untapped creatures you control: Root-Kin Ally gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: From the seeds of faith, great forests grow.
cards.name: Scatter the Seeds
cards.text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
Put three 1/1 green Saproling creature tokens onto the battlefield.

cards.flavor: It has a hundred thousand extinctions to avenge.
cards.name: Scion of the Wild
cards.text: Scion of the Wild's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creatures you control.

cards.flavor:
"Survival rule 781: There are always more scute bugs."
—Zurdi, goblin shortcutter
cards.name: Scute Mob
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you control five or more lands, put four +1/+1 counters on Scute Mob.

cards.flavor: Simic initiates begin their training as experimental subjects. Failures are flushed to the undersewers.
cards.name: Simic Initiate
cards.text: Graft 1 (This creature enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it. Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, you may move a +1/+1 counter from this creature onto it.)

cards.flavor: Centuries of wind, rain, and roots compressed into an instant of destruction: such is the power of Selesnya.
cards.name: Sundering Vitae
cards.text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
Destroy target artifact or enchantment.

cards.flavor: Some who scouted new lands chose to stay.
cards.name: Sylvan Bounty
cards.text:
Target player gains 8 life.
Basic landcycling {1}{G} ({1}{G}, Discard this card: Search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.)

cards.flavor: What doesn't grow, dies. And what dies grows the tarmogoyf.
cards.name: Tarmogoyf
cards.text: Tarmogoyf's power is equal to the number of card types among cards in all graveyards and its toughness is equal to that number plus 1.

cards.flavor: The most successful of Simic creations is cytoplasm, a living, symbiotic substance that feeds off genetic rhythms and strengthens its host in return.
cards.name: Thrive
cards.text: Put a +1/+1 counter on each of X target creatures.

cards.flavor: Jund's thallids tried to disguise their deliciousness by covering themselves in spines harvested from the tukatongue tree.
cards.name: Tukatongue Thallid
cards.text: When Tukatongue Thallid dies, put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Vines of Vastwood
cards.text:
Kicker {G} (You may pay an additional {G} as you cast this spell.)
Target creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control this turn. If Vines of Vastwood was kicked, that creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn.

cards.name: Wolfbriar Elemental
cards.text:
Multikicker {G} (You may pay an additional {G} any number of times as you cast this spell.)
When Wolfbriar Elemental enters the battlefield, put a 2/2 green Wolf creature token onto the battlefield for each time it was kicked.

cards.flavor: Life's circle has become inverted in Grixis. The same energy is endlessly recycled and becomes more stagnant with each pass.
cards.name: Agony Warp
cards.text:
Target creature gets -3/-0 until end of turn.
Target creature gets -0/-3 until end of turn.

cards.name: Apocalypse Hydra
cards.text:
Apocalypse Hydra enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it. If X is 5 or more, it enters the battlefield with an additional X +1/+1 counters on it.
{1}{R}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Apocalypse Hydra: Apocalypse Hydra deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.flavor: When the Boros Legion attacks, swiftblades enter the fray first. They pick off the archers and mages, softening the enemy front before the flame-kin and giants go in.
cards.name: Boros Swiftblade
cards.text: Double strike

cards.flavor:
"The Golgari expand, yes, but I refuse to call their tainted creations ‘growth.'"
—Veszka, Selesnya evangel
cards.name: Drooling Groodion
cards.text: {2}{B}{G}, Sacrifice a creature: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn. Another target creature gets -2/-2 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: The Izzet learn something from every lesson they teach.
cards.name: Electrolyze
cards.text:
Electrolyze deals 2 damage divided as you choose among one or two target creatures and/or players.
Draw a card.

cards.flavor: "We coat ourselves in steel every day. What is etherium but the next logical step?"
cards.name: Ethercaste Knight
cards.text: Exalted (Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, that creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)

cards.name: Ghost Council of Orzhova
cards.text:
When Ghost Council of Orzhova enters the battlefield, target opponent loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.
{1}, Sacrifice a creature: Exile Ghost Council of Orzhova. Return it to the battlefield under its owner's control at the beginning of the next end step.

cards.text:
Whenever another artifact enters the battlefield under your control, Glassdust Hulk gets +1/+1 until end of turn and can't be blocked this turn.
Cycling {W/U} ({W/U}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

cards.flavor: Even the oldest treefolk was but an acorn when Lorwyn's first mysteries were born.
cards.name: Horde of Notions
cards.text:
Vigilance, trample, haste
{W}{U}{B}{R}{G}: You may play target Elemental card from your graveyard without paying its mana cost.

cards.flavor:
"The enlightenment I never found in etherium I have found traced in the coatl's scales."
—Ranalus, vedalken heretic
cards.name: Lorescale Coatl
cards.text: Whenever you draw a card, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Lorescale Coatl.

cards.flavor: Its fangs are in your flesh before its hiss leaves your ears.
cards.name: Mystic Snake
cards.text:
Flash
When Mystic Snake enters the battlefield, counter target spell.

cards.flavor:
"Those may be the squirms of one life ending or of another beginning. Either way, I'd leave it alone."
—Rakka Mar
cards.name: Necrogenesis
cards.text: {2}: Exile target creature card from a graveyard. Put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Niv-Mizzet, the Firemind
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever you draw a card, Niv-Mizzet, the Firemind deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
{T}: Draw a card.

cards.flavor: Which is worse—the sleep which never ends or that which never comes?
cards.name: Pillory of the Sleepless
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block.
Enchanted creature has "At the beginning of your upkeep, you lose 1 life."

cards.name: Plaxcaster Frogling

Graft 3 (This creature enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it. Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, you may move a +1/+1 counter from this creature onto it.)
{2}: Target creature with a +1/+1 counter on it gains shroud until end of turn. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

cards.flavor:
"Nature is the ultimate mindless destroyer, capable of power and ferocity no army can match, and the Gruul follow its example."
—Trigori, Azorius senator
cards.name: Savage Twister
cards.text: Savage Twister deals X damage to each creature.

cards.name: Shadowmage Infiltrator
cards.text:
Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
Whenever Shadowmage Infiltrator deals combat damage to a player, you may draw a card.

cards.flavor: "For unwavering commitment and unflinching strength, the Order of the White Orchid confers its sigil. Rise, knight-captain, and do your duty."
cards.name: Sigil Blessing
cards.text: Until end of turn, target creature you control gets +3/+3 and other creatures you control get +1/+1.

cards.name: Vengeful Rebirth
cards.text:
Return target card from your graveyard to your hand. If you return a nonland card to your hand this way, Vengeful Rebirth deals damage equal to that card's converted mana cost to target creature or player.
Exile Vengeful Rebirth.

cards.flavor: Rakdos festivals almost leave enough rubble in their wake to hide the bodies.
cards.name: Wrecking Ball
cards.text: Destroy target creature or land.

cards.flavor: After his hands had crumbled away, leaving only wickedly sharp points, he decided his only purpose was war.
cards.name: Ashenmoor Gouger
cards.text: Ashenmoor Gouger can't block.

cards.name: Creakwood Liege
cards.text:
Other black creatures you control get +1/+1.

({U/B} can be paid with either {U} or {B}.)
{3}{U}: Target player draws a card. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
{3}{B}: Target player discards a card. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

cards.flavor:
"Unsafe Terrain Ahead—Turn Back"
—Sign near the former location of Pyrtagh Cairn

cards.flavor: Hobgoblins are best left alone. They sharpen their farm implements far more than is necessary for their work in the fields.

cards.flavor:
"A great siege is a banquet to him; a long and terrible battle, the most exquisite delicacy."
—The Seer's Parables

Flying
Attacking creatures you control get +2/+0.

cards.flavor: Any being that harms them quickly learns its lesson.

cards.text:
Flying
If a source would deal damage to Swans of Bryn Argoll, prevent that damage. The source's controller draws cards equal to the damage prevented this way.

cards.flavor: With or without witnesses, the suns continued their prismatic dance.
cards.name: Alloy Myr
cards.text: {T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

cards.flavor:
"We thank the souleaters for inscribing our souls with subservience, to reinforce the sacred order."
—Drones' hymn of gratitude

cards.text: {W/P}, {T}: Tap target creature. ({W/P} can be paid with either {W} or 2 life.)

cards.flavor: Instead of creating a tool that would be damaged by heat, the Thran built one that was charged by it.

cards.flavor:
"We will fight as they do: our flesh protected behind metal."
—Tae Aquil, Viridian weaponsmith

"Forswear the flesh and you will truly see."
—Jin-Gitaxias, Core Augur

cards.flavor: Heavier than it looks, tricky to wield, guaranteed to last.

cards.flavor: Its predecessors were etched with the wisdom of ancients; its own etchings bear warnings of a future fraught with war.

cards.flavor: Now etched only with the scars of phyresis.

cards.flavor:
"I use maps to find out where explorers have already been. Then I go the other way."
—Javad Nasrin, Ondu relic hunter
cards.name: Expedition Map
cards.text: {2}, {T}, Sacrifice Expedition Map: Search your library for a land card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Flayer Husk

cards.flavor: At first, vedalken observers thought blinkmoths naturally avoided certain places. Then they realized those places were frogmite feeding grounds.
cards.name: Frogmite
cards.text: Affinity for artifacts (This spell costs {1} less to cast for each artifact you control.)

cards.name: Glint Hawk Idol
cards.text:
Whenever another artifact enters the battlefield under your control, you may have Glint Hawk Idol become a 2/2 Bird artifact creature with flying until end of turn.
{W}: Glint Hawk Idol becomes a 2/2 Bird artifact creature with flying until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Phyrexian smog clouds choked the skies, threatening creatures who couldn't comprehend the menace below.
cards.name: Gust-Skimmer
cards.text: {U}: Gust-Skimmer gains flying until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Kitesailing is a way of life—and without practice, the end of it.
cards.name: Kitesail
cards.text:
Equipped creature gets +1/+0 and has flying.
Equip {2} ({2}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

cards.flavor:
"Somehow it warps the Æther. It brings a strange weight, a blockade in the flow of spellcraft."
—Noyan Dar, Tazeem lullmage
cards.name: Lodestone Golem
cards.text: Nonartifact spells cost {1} more to cast.

cards.flavor: When necessary, myr can override and control any artificial object, as can their creator.
cards.name: Lodestone Myr
cards.text:
Trample
Tap an untapped artifact you control: Lodestone Myr gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Long ago, the priests would wave the gohei to call down the gods. Now it lies forgotten, but the spirits still feel its pull.
cards.name: Long-Forgotten Gohei
cards.text:
Arcane spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
Spirit creatures you control get +1/+1.

cards.name: Mortarpod

cards.flavor: The suns of Mirrodin have shone upon perfection only once.
cards.name: Mox Opal
cards.text: Metalcraft — {T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool. Activate this ability only if you control three or more artifacts.

cards.flavor: Most myr monitor other species. Some myr monitor other myr.
cards.name: Myr Enforcer
cards.text: Affinity for artifacts (This spell costs {1} less to cast for each artifact you control.)

cards.name: Precursor Golem
cards.text:
When Precursor Golem enters the battlefield, put two 3/3 colorless Golem artifact creature tokens onto the battlefield.
Whenever a player casts an instant or sorcery spell that targets only a single Golem, that player copies that spell for each other Golem that spell could target. Each copy targets a different one of those Golems.

cards.flavor: Scholars had puzzled for centuries over the ruins at Tal Terig. Its secrets had always lived within one rune-carved head.
cards.name: Runed Servitor
cards.text: When Runed Servitor dies, each player draws a card.

cards.flavor:
"We consider rust a curable disease."
—Tarrin, Hammer-Tribe shaman
cards.name: Rusted Relic
cards.text: Metalcraft — Rusted Relic is a 5/5 Golem artifact creature as long as you control three or more artifacts.

cards.name: Sickleslicer

cards.flavor: As the dawns break, the manta soars.
cards.name: Skyreach Manta
cards.text:
Sunburst (This enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it for each color of mana spent to cast it.)
Flying

cards.flavor:
"Let's show Vorinclex that progress doesn't always need teeth or claws."
—Malcator, Executor of Synthesis
cards.name: Spellskite
cards.text: {U/P}: Change a target of target spell or ability to Spellskite. ({U/P} can be paid with either {U} or 2 life.)

cards.name: Sphere of the Suns
cards.text:
Sphere of the Suns enters the battlefield tapped and with three charge counters on it.
{T}, Remove a charge counter from Sphere of the Suns: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

cards.name: Sunforger

cards.flavor: Magnetic devices that keep massive golems and structures standing can also be used for the opposite purpose.
cards.name: Tumble Magnet
cards.text:
Tumble Magnet enters the battlefield with three charge counters on it.
{T}, Remove a charge counter from Tumble Magnet: Tap target artifact or creature.

cards.flavor: It is the forest beyond the horizon, the mountain waiting to be climbed, the new land across the endless sea.
cards.name: Wayfarer's Bauble
cards.text: {2}, {T}, Sacrifice Wayfarer's Bauble: Search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Azorius Chancery
cards.text:
Azorius Chancery enters the battlefield tapped.
When Azorius Chancery enters the battlefield, return a land you control to its owner's hand.
{T}: Add {W}{U} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Blinkmoth Nexus
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{1}: Blinkmoth Nexus becomes a 1/1 Blinkmoth artifact creature with flying until end of turn. It's still a land.
{1}, {T}: Target Blinkmoth creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

Boros Garrison enters the battlefield tapped.
When Boros Garrison enters the battlefield, return a land you control to its owner's hand.
{T}: Add {R}{W} to your mana pool.

cards.flavor: Structures built from darksteel yield to neither assault nor age.

cards.text:
Indestructible (Effects that say "destroy" don't destroy this land.)
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.

{T}: Add {U}{B} to your mana pool.

cards.flavor: Each temple is a door to a horrible future.
cards.name: Eldrazi Temple
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{T}: Add {2} to your mana pool. Spend this mana only to cast colorless Eldrazi spells or activate abilities of colorless Eldrazi.

cards.flavor: Every world is an organism, able to grow new lands. Some just do it faster than others.
cards.name: Evolving Wilds
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Evolving Wilds: Search your library for a basic land card and put it onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.
